{"step_by_step_thinking": "The infant is presenting with respiratory failure and physical examination findings of low-set ears and retrognathia, which are characteristic of Pierre Robin sequence. Pierre Robin sequence is associated with micrognathia (retrognathia) and can lead to respiratory distress due to the small size of the mandible and resulting obstruction of the airway. Pulmonary hypoplasia can occur as a consequence of the respiratory distress. Therefore, the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms is Pierre Robin sequence.", "answer_choice": "C"}
